gui.BuddyAudioClient.BuddyAudioClient¶

class gui.BuddyAudioClient.BuddyAudioClient(ip_addr, port, frame=None)¶

Bases: object

A TCP client that sends microphone input audio data. Uses pyaudio to get mic input. Then sends audio data as raw bytes.

Parameters

  • ip_addr (string) – the ip address of the server

  • port (int) – the port number of the server

  • frame (Tkinter Frame, optional) – frame used in error display, defaults to None

__init__(ip_addr, port, frame=None)¶

Constructor for BuddyAudioClient

Methods

__init__(ip_addr, port[, frame])

Constructor for BuddyAudioClient

connect()

Starts a new thread to connect to the server if not connected yet.

disconnect()

Disconnect from the server.

getCurrentDeviceName()

Returns the current input device name

getInputDeviceDicts()

Gets a list of dictionaries which contain info about the input audio devices.

getInputDeviceNames()

Gets the names of all audio input devices on the current instance of self.audio_handler.

initAudioHandler()

Resets the pyaudio.Pyaudio() object.

isStreaming()

Checks if pyaudio stream is active

refreshHandler()

Refreshes the current self.audio_handler pyaudio.Pyaudio object.

setDeviceDictToDefault()

Sets the current_device_dict back to its default

setInputDevice(device_name)

Changes the current input device from which audio data is pulled.

setPortNum(new_port)

Sets the port number used to connect to the server.

showError(errorText)

Displays an error on the Tkinter frame pass in the constructor

startStream([waitForConnect])

Starts a thread to begin streaming audio data if connected or if waitForConnect is true.

stopStream()

Stops the stream thread if running.

streamLoop()

Gets chunk_size bytes of audio data from audio device and sends that data as a packet of raw bytes to the server.

Attributes

default_chunk_size

default_num_input_channels

default_sampling_rate

default_width

connect()¶

Starts a new thread to connect to the server if not connected yet. Does nothing if already connected.

disconnect()¶

Disconnect from the server.

getCurrentDeviceName()¶

Returns the current input device name

Returns

The name of the current device

Return type

String

getInputDeviceDicts()¶

Gets a list of dictionaries which contain info about the input audio devices.

Returns

A list of dictionaries containing audio device info

Return type

list[dict]

getInputDeviceNames()¶

Gets the names of all audio input devices on the current instance of self.audio_handler. Returns it as a list of strings

Returns

A list of strings which are the device names

Return type

list[String]

initAudioHandler()¶

Resets the pyaudio.Pyaudio() object. Terminates and re inits it.

isStreaming()¶

Checks if pyaudio stream is active

Returns

True if streaming audio data, False otherwise

Return type

boolean

refreshHandler()¶

Refreshes the current self.audio_handler pyaudio.Pyaudio object. Stops the stream, terminates the current audio_handler, inits a new one, then starts the stream if it was previously running. This function uses context manager to prevent premature starting of the stream.

setDeviceDictToDefault()¶

Sets the current_device_dict back to its default

setInputDevice(device_name)¶

Changes the current input device from which audio data is pulled.

Parameters

device_name (String) – the name of the device which will become the new input

setPortNum(new_port)¶

Sets the port number used to connect to the server.

Parameters

new_port (int) – the value to set self.port_num to

showError(errorText)¶

Displays an error on the Tkinter frame pass in the constructor

Parameters

errorText (String) – the text that will be displayed in the error

startStream(waitForConnect=False)¶

Starts a thread to begin streaming audio data if connected or if waitForConnect is true. Value of waitForConnect is passed to _startStream()

Parameters

waitForConnect (boolean, optional) – if true will allow the stream thread to begin before connection to server is established. Defaults to False

Returns

true if thread is started, false otherwise

Return type

boolean

stopStream()¶

Stops the stream thread if running.

streamLoop()¶

Gets chunk_size bytes of audio data from audio device and sends that data as a packet of raw bytes to the server.

Survivor Buddy 4.0
